div.p:
With an area of 308.2 kmÂ², Udawalawe National Park is one of Sri Lanka's smallest national parks. More than 500 elephants are thought to reside in this 
 area.A wide variety of other animals, including as water buffalo, sloth bears and spotted deer can 
 be found in Udawalawe.

The Sinharaja Forest Reserve is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.Numerous plant andanimal species, many of which are peculiar to Sri Lanka, can be found 
 in the reserve. The Sri Lankan elephant, leopard, purple-faced langur and a variety of birds including 
 the Sri Lanka blue magpie and Sri Lanka spurfowl are among the most famous species that can be found in the reserve. The conservation 
 area gives visitors not just a wealth of species but also the chance to take in the splendour of a tropical rainforest, complete with lush greenery 
 and beautiful waterfalls.

The most significant location for the catchment of almost all major rivers in SriLanka is Horton Plains, together with the surrounding forests and the 
 Peak Wilderness. The majority of the unique plant and animal species that are unique to the wet and 
 montane zones of the nation can be found on the Horton plains, which are renowned for their exceptional visual splendour.
